intro: Pentacalia guadalupe, commonly known as Guadalupe milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweed species known for their milky sap. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Pentacalia guadalupe thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open woodlands.
